intro: Cacalia canescens, commonly known as the hoary cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its leaves are covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a silvery appearance, and its flowers are usually pale blue or purple. Cacalia canescens is adapted to arid environments and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
